FuncDef:
The port-queue low-latency-mode command configures the low delay mode for port queues on an interface.
The undo port-queue low-latency-mode command cancels the configuration.
This command varies in transport and router modes. For detailed differences, see Differences Between Commands in Transport and Router Modes. This topic describes the command configuration in router mode.
By default, the low delay mode is not configured for port queues.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
TDM services require low delay. To configure the low delay mode for port queues on an MP-group interface, run the port-queue low-latency-mode command.
Configuration Impact
The low delay mode applies to services on the MP-group interface.
